Key Match Events: Cole Palmer scored his first senior international goal from the penalty spot on his first England start
Harry Kane added further gloss to the scoreline from close range
Trent Alexander-Arnold scored a sweet volley five minutes from time
Kane squirmed the rebound beyond Vasilj after Konsa inadvertently denied Bowen his first England goal
Pre-Game Insights: Gareth Southgate insisted that this was not a trial in itself, suggesting the makeup of his ideal squad is already fairly clear in his mind
Southgate had decided against giving debuts to any of the five uncapped players in his squad from the start
Post-Match Reflections: Gareth Southgate praised the team's performance, stating that the scoreline reflected the performance
Southgate mentioned that he'd rather have good performances that caused selection headaches than poor performances
Harry Kane allayed fitness fears, stating he is feeling good and has been taking a good break after a tough season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was England's first of two final warm-up friendlies for Euro 2024
The team now moves on to face Iceland at Wembley on Friday night before the Group C opener against Serbia in Gelsenkirchen on June 16
Others: Eberechi Eze was comfortably England's liveliest player in a pedestrian first half
Alexander-Arnold has been excellent since the interval, both in midfield and since switching to right-back after the opening goal
